name: Live births (22 weeks gestation)
datasetName: Live births in England and Wales under 22 weeks (ONS, 2018)

source.name: Live births in UK under 22 weeks (ONS, 2018)
source.additionalInfo:
The total number of live births recorded in England and Wales at and below 22 weeks of gestation. 23 weeks is typically the threshold of extreme viability for infants; whilst survival of infants at 22 to 23 weeks is no longer exceptional (one-third of infants born at 22-23 weeks in England and Wales in 2015 survived), mortality rates remain very high.

Stillbirths for infants prior to 24 weeks are not recorded, and live birth statistics for infants born prior to 23 weeks was not typically reported in official statistics prior to 2014.
